block.p: Sarah Hermanson, a daughter of Susan and Terry Hermanson of New York, was married yesterday to Adam Paul Meister, a son of Nancy Deeds Meister and Joel S. Meister, both of Tucson. The Rev. David W. Good, a Congregational minister, performed the outdoor ceremony in Niantic.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an assistant curator of photography at the Museum of Modern Art in New York. She graduated cum laude from Princeton. Her mother is a lay pastoral minister at St. James' Episcopal Church in New York. Her father is the president of Mr. Christmas Inc., a manufacturer of Christmas decorations in New York.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an assistant curator of photography at the Museum of Modern Art in New York. She graduated cum laude from Princeton. Her mother is a lay pastoral minister at St. James' Episcopal Church in New York. Her father is the president of Mr. Christmas Inc., a manufacturer of Christmas decorations in New York.

The bridegroom, 28, is a candidate for an M.B.A. degree at Columbia. He graduated cum laude from Harvard. His mother is a social worker at the University Medical Center in Tucson. His father is a professor of public health at the University of Arizona in Tucson and the director of the university's Southwest Center for Community Health Promotion.
